intro: Leiopoa nuda, commonly known as the naked leiope, is a small, flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, pale blue to white flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or gravelly soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Leiopoa nuda is considered a rare and endangered species.
